content.prompt: Dr. Jamal surveys parents of children of fifth graders who have done well in school. Based on his survey results, Dr. Jamal claims that being raised as an only child accelerates how quickly students will be able to progress to concrete operational thinking. What problem is associated with this claim?

choices.label: Dr. Jamal places too much significance on grading to justify the claim.
Dr. Jamal did not randomly assign participants in his study.
Dr. Jamal cannot make a cause-and-effect claim from survey results.
Dr. Jamal should have surveyed the children directly to justify the claims he made.

skill.text: 2.C: Evaluate the appropriate use of research design elements in non-experimental methodologies.
